text: This is my local pho spot on the Plateau.. Ohhh and they now deliver :)  They're always consistent and I find the prices good for a Vietnamese restaurant. The food is is fresh and I know I can count on a good bowl of pho when I'm craving it. Broth is usually flavourful and they also have great Bun. I'm glad it's around the corner from me!

Food - Rare beef, classic pho. Broth was bland, noodles stuck, beef wasn't right. Spicy sauce on the side disappointing. It was pho but not the best I've ever had.  Service - Mediocre  Ambience - Not too hot on a Wednesday night

used to be good 2 years ago..... came back to try 3 times, but just getting worse and worse.  I don't know what happened to the kitchen but I believe the chef has left.  I took a pho and I had to drink up 3 glasses of water afterwards.  Can't believe what they put in there !!

I stopped by here with a few friends when I was in the area. I ordered the won ton entree, not knowing how big the portion would be. it was pretty big! a lot of it was Chinese noodles with the won tons, but I felt full after just the won tons. The portions were pretty good, but I wouldn't go as far as to say that it's my favorite won ton restaurant.

S'il y a bien un endroit où les soupes vietnamiennes (pho) sont à leur meilleur, c'est le Wok N'Roll. Je ne sais pas si le bouillon est bourré de glutamate monosodique, mais en tout les cas, il rend vraiment dépendant et excite les papilles gustatives. Je ne peux m'empêcher de frétiller d'engouement devant un repas aussi lénifiant (immense bol de bonheur)...surtout lorsqu'on se gèle le derche sous zéro en plein hiver québécois. L'on mange entouré d'un décoration sobre, et si vous êtes assis non-loin du petit autel domestique bouddhiste, n'osez surtout pas le toucher, même si la curiosité vous démange... car les offrandes sont sacrées...  L'été, c'est différent, on aime bien être sur la terrasse et témoigner de la frénésie de Saint-Denis en accompagnant son repas d'une bière en fût. Pour ma part, que ce soit en été ou en hiver, chaque fois que je me rends ici, c'est pour me gaver de la fameuse pho au poulet grillé. Mais ce n'est pas qu'une simple soupe au poulet; le bouillon, qui est succulent (faut-il le rappeler), est couvert de coriandre fraîche, d'oignons séchés, de bok choy cuits à la vapeur, et d'échalotes. Si vous avez l'habitude des épices, votre goût fin dénotera sans doute l'indispensable des pho : l'anis étoilé... C'est bon pour le rhume et la digestion, en plus!  Il n'y a pas que des soupes à la tonne; tous les repas traditionnellement vietnamiens sont proposés, allant des rouleaux de printemps jusqu'aux nouilles frites. Non il n'y joue pas de Rock N'Roll; ce n'est qu'un mauvais jeu de mot...

Sorry but - it was so bad I had to join Yelp. They were rude, confused, forgot to place my order. I was the only customer and after sitting there for 20 minutes I stood up and politely said I couldn't wait any longer. The waitresses... Not a happy time in her life I suppose. Sorry to see people so miserable like that but we're the customers aren't we..   Two stars instead of one out of guilt, or is it empathy?

Cheap and easy lunch. Slow service. Food was mediocre. Got quite busy at lunch. Great patio, was perfect for people watching along the busy street. Asked for gluten free options but the waitstaff was unsure about what that meant.

Un restaurant à prix modique où nous avons eu d'excellentes expériences. Le poulet général tao et le pad thai sont nos choix privilégiés. Les proprios et employés sont sympas et le service est rapide. Il nous est arrivé une expérience où le général tao n'était pas à la hauteur (1 fois sur 10, c'est pas mal!). Même à une occasion où nous étions 8 personnes, tous ont été ravis ! Si vous cherchez un endroit simple, efficace et où on mange bien à prix raisonnable, c'est la place !

This is simply one of my favourite places in the city! Doesn't hurt that i have a love affair with asian food but i can truly say this is one of the best Vietnamese places in town. They serve many other type of dishes like pad thai ,  pho soup, fried rice and other typical asian dishes - however i specifically go there for the same type of meal which is a bowl of Noodles with grilled chicken/beef or/and shrimp ! With that comes a salad and the most delicious spring roll EVER!   They have a patio during the summer and is situated on St-denis street, right in the heart of Mont Royal neighbourhood ! I've been here many times with different people and i ( or anyone i've been with ) have never been disappointed.  A good place to know in town!

Je commande souvent de là. La soupe végé est débile. Le bouillon est parfait, j'avoue desfois il est plus goûteux que d'autres, mais en général c'est excellent. Les dumplings et les rouleaux sont bons, les sauces qui viennent avec aussi. Une valeur sûre.

Food is very good and price is quite reasonable. They offer delivery through just-eat. Their deep fried banana desert is very delicious. People working there are polite and the delivery is fast. It has quickly become my main go to Chinese / Asian restaurant for delivery in my area.

The food here is alright. Cheaper than many places, but quality is not always the best. The vermicelli is a little bland, the grilled pork with rice tasted wonderful, and the pho could have been better as the broth was a little bland as well.
I've been hard-pressed to find good Chinese food since I left Vancouver, but DAMN this shit was good. Repeat costumer from me for sure!
Delicious pho and the lemon grass grilled chicken with vermicelli was awesome.  Authentic Vietnamese -- the best we've had in Montreal.

La nourriture est pas mauvaise mais ils doivent avoir quelqu'un d'autre pour répondre au téléphone pour prendre les commandes de livraison parce que ca fait 3 fois que j'appelle labas et c'est toujours aussi désagréable de répéter 200 fois la même affaire à une personne qui comprend rien à ce que vous dites et qui a du mal à vous répéter correctement ce que vous avez dit. En raccrochant elle n'avait même pas la bonne adresse et le livreur a du appeler 2 fois pour pouvoir trouver mon emplacement. J'ai attendu une bonne heure et franchement c'était très décourageant. Juste pour la nourriture ca va, mais le service est vraiment mauvais. Besoin d'une autre standardiste.
Hearty portions, inexpensive and with a pleasant outdoor terrace. We like the soups and the fried dishes for a quick meal in our neighbourhood.

Used to not like asian food .. untill i've eat there ..their grill are soo good and the soup is heavenly. ..price was good and because we had to wait a bit long the manager sent us rolls to excuse for the delay...thank you:)

Food is not good. The Tao chicken was hard and my husband felt sick after eating the Crispy Noodles with beef.  Service is horrible. The server wouldn't even bother replying to our hellos and thank yous. As if he just wanted to get over with his shift. At the time of paying the bill we were so let down with our experience that I chose not to tip more then a few dollars for my total bill of $34. To this the server DEMANDED we pay as much as 10% clearly oblivious to the fact that the tip is at the customers discretion and given based on the overall dining experience. He forced the Tip Jar in our faces and kept repeating that this isn't enough and as we didn't want to create a scene, we added more dollars to the jar and left.  I am a generous tipper normally but regardless have never faced such a situation before. Would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

Très "bof" pour la livraison, du moins. Tout est froid, même la soupe. C'est tout dire... Le poulet sauté thaï était très ordinaire. Au fait, ou était le poulet? J'ai surtout trouvé de gros morceaux de brocoli non pas al dente mais crus. Le riz était tellement cuit, on aurait dit une boule de pâte. Très compact. La petite soupe pho de l'entrée était correct mais on trouve mieux dans le quartier chinois. Rouleaux aux crevettes, vous dites? Mon Dieu! D'insipides crevettes enrobées d'une pâte tout aussi insipide et blanche. Imaginez croquer dans ça quand c'est froid. Non, je n'ai pas aimé du tout. Les deux étoiles vont principalement à la soupe.

My family was visiting me recently and in the two weeks they were here,  they went to Wok n Roll three times. We were all charmed by their delicious grilled lemongrass chicken/pork, crispy noodles (my sister's favorite) and general tao chicken. Their simple salad was always fresh fresh too, although the pad thai was not great and I don't recommend it. I think I will be a regular there from now on. It's good to know that there is hope for good and reasonably priced Asian food outside Chinatown. Plus there is a nice terrace!
arrived very quickly. great pad thai. other dish (#65) was very fresh, fresh veg and fresh shrimp but a little lacking in flavour, thats why the rating is 4 not 5. will def order again!
